data.text:
The Only 5 Beer Movies You NEED To See!

How good is beer! That's not a question, that's a statement. So it's no surprise that this lovely beverage has found its way into popular culture, including movies. From comedies to dramas, beer has been a central theme in many films. Here we take a look at the definitive top 5 beer movies of all time.

5. The Greatest Beer Run Ever (2022)

It’s not only the most recent beer movie, but also one of the wildest. Based on a true story, The Greatest Beer Run Ever follows a former Marine (Zac Efron) as he hopes to lift the spirits of his friends fighting in the Vietnam War by bringing them a can of their favorite beer.

While it’s been met with mixed reviews, no one can deny the film has its heart in the right place as a love letter to the sometimes irrational, but ever-glorious comradery forged between drinking buddies. While ultimately a comedy, it isn’t afraid to depict the ambiguity of war and utilizes its impressive cast to pack a hefty emotional wallop.

4. Superbad (2007)

The film follows two high school seniors, Seth and Evan, who are determined to get alcohol for a party in order to impress their crushes. Superbad is filled with scenes of beer drinking, partying, and hilarious hijinks, making it a classic coming-of-age comedy that is beloved by many. While the focus of the film isn't solely on beer, it's certainly a major part of the plot and is an important aspect of the characters' journey. Overall, Superbad is a must-watch for anyone who loves beer, comedy, and classic teen movies.

3. The World's End (2013)

The World's End is a British sci-fi comedy that follows a group of old friends as they attempt to recreate an epic pub crawl from their youth, only to find themselves in the midst of an alien invasion. Directed by Edgar Wright and starring Simon Pegg and Nick Frost, the movie is a hilarious take on the end-of-the-world genre, with plenty of beer drinking along the way. The World's End is a great movie for anyone who loves a good laugh and a good pint.

2. Beerfest (2006)

Beerfest is a raucous comedy that follows a group of American friends who travel to Germany to participate in a secret beer-drinking competition called Beerfest. Along the way, they encounter rival teams, stumble across hidden agendas, and drink copious amounts of beer. The movie was directed by Jay Chandrasekhar, who also starred as one of the lead characters. With its hilarious antics and over-the-top beer drinking, Beerfest is a great movie for anyone looking for a good laugh.

1. Strange Brew (1983)

"Take off, you hoser!" Strange Brew is a Canadian comedy classic that tells the story of two beer-loving brothers, Bob and Doug McKenzie, who find themselves embroiled in a plot to take over a brewery. The movie was directed by Rick Moranis and Dave Thomas, who also starred as the McKenzie brothers. With its signature catchphrases, slapstick humour, and love of all things beer, Strange Brew is a must-watch for any beer enthusiast.

So to wrap it up, beer is the best! Beer has been a popular theme in movies for decades, and there are many great films that feature this beloved beverage. Whether you're looking for a classic comedy, a coming of age story, or a sci-fi adventure, there's a beer movie out there for you. These five movies are the best of the best, and they're sure to entertain and delight anyone who loves beer and the culture that surrounds it.
